Detailed Description

Creates unique three particle events in the CM frame and Lab frame.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

eventGenerator::eventGenerator ( double  nu  ) 

Constructor to initialize all local class members such as the random number generator and Monte Carlo x,y generator.

Parameters:
nu 2m_e/M where nu^2 is the bottom boundary for the parameter x (nu used in the constructor argument of XY generator, this constructor is simply a pass through).

eventGenerator::eventGenerator ( double  nu,
const char *  CMfilename 
)

Constructor to initialize all local class members such as the random number generator and Monte Carlo x,y generator, this constructor is used specifically to supply the class with a filepath output CM events into.

Parameters:
nu 2m_e/M where nu^2 is the bottom boundary for the parameter x (nu used in the constructor argument of XY generator, this constructor is also a pass through)
CMfilename the string path used for the filestream to output CM events in the generateEvent() method

Member Function Documentation

void eventGenerator::boostToLab ( TLorentzVector *&  evtP,
double  initial_p,
double  M 
) [private]

Boosts the particles in the referenced 4vector array along a boost vector whose magnitude is determined by the initial conditions but has a randomly generated direction.

Parameters:
evtP The address of the pointer to a 4 vector array.
initial_p The initial momentum of the system in the lab frame.
M the mass of the pion.

TLorentzVector* eventGenerator::generateEvent ( double  M,
double  m_e,
double  initial_p 
)

Creates a three particle event and returns the set of particles in a 4 vector array.

Parameters:
M the mass of the pion.
m_e the mass of the electron/positron.
initial_p The initial momentum of the system in the lab frame.
Returns:
A pointer to TLorentzVector array of length N particles+1.

TLorentzVector eventGenerator::makeElectron ( double  x,
double  y,
double  M,
double  m_e 
) [private]

Creates a 4vector for an electron in the event, given the conditions provided by the arguments.

Parameters:
x the electron/positron invariant mass, created by XY generator.
y Energy partition in the CM frame, created by XY generator.
M the mass of the pion.
m_e the mass of the electron/positron.
Returns:
a TLorentzVector for the electron.

) [private]

void eventGenerator::rotateSystem ( TLorentzVector *&  evtP  )  [private]

Takes in a 4vector array and rotates the particle system about the x,y and z axis.

void eventGenerator::vectorPrinter ( TLorentzVector *  v  )  [private]

Debugging method that prints the contents of a 4vector array.

void eventGenerator::writeEvent ( ostream &  f1,
TLorentzVector *&  evtP 
) [private]

Helper method to write an 4vector Array in the specified file steam, the PIDs for the standard .hepevt output format are hardcoded into a array that exists only in the scope of this function.

Parameters:
f1 the filestream to be written to.
evtP the CM rotated 4vector array

Member Data Documentation

ofstream eventGenerator::CMfs [private]

Filestream shunted into event generator to output the CM events to .hepevt files

bool eventGenerator::CMwrite [private]

Boolean flag to indicate to the class whether to write CM events to file

TRandom1* eventGenerator::RNG [private]

Local copy of the random number generator used for generating the random directions of the particle rotations and random boost direction.

XYgenerator* eventGenerator::xygen [private]

Local copy of XYgenerator to supply particle creation methods with x and y values.
